item.title: Vicki add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Vicki add a quote by Phyllis Diller
item.description: "Never go to bed mad. Stay up and fight." -- Phyllis Diller

item.title: Vicki add a quote by David Hume
item.description: "Beauty is no quality in things themselves: It exists merely in the mind which contemplates them; and each mind perceives a different beauty." -- David Hume

item.title: Vicki add a quote by Sigmund Freud
item.description: "The more the fruits of knowledge become accessible to men, the more widespread is the decline of religious belief." -- Sigmund Freud

item.title: Vicki add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "To lengthen thy life, lessen thy meals." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Vicki add a quote by Marlene Dietrich
item.description: "Once a woman has forgiven her man, she must not reheat his sins for breakfast." -- Marlene Dietrich

item.title: Vicki add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Gardening is not a rational act." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Vicki add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Vicki add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Vicki add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Vicki add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "It isn't enough to talk about peace. One must believe in it. And it isn't enough to believe in it. One must work at it." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Vicki add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "It is not fair to ask of others what you are not willing to do yourself." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Vicki add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "Do what you feel in your heart to be right – for you’ll be criticized anyway." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Vicki add a quote by G. Stanley Hall
item.description: "Gross well says that children are young because they play, and not vice versa; and he might have added, men grow old because they stop playing, and not conversely, for play is, at bottom, growth, and at the top of the intellectual scale it is the eternal type of research from sheer love of truth." -- G. Stanley Hall

item.title: Vicki add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Vicki add a quote by Scott Adams
item.description: "I love you like a fat kid loves cake!" -- Scott Adams

item.title: Vicki add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Love is a better master than duty." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Vicki add a quote by Alfred Lord Tennyson
item.description: "If I had a flower for every time I thought of you...I could walk through my garden forever." -- Alfred Lord Tennyson

item.title: Vicki add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "What difference does it make to the dead, the orphans and the homeless, whether the mad destruction is wrought under the name of totalitarianism or in the holy name of liberty or democracy?" -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Vicki add a quote by Dwight D. Eisenhower
item.description: "Every gun that is made, every warship launched, every rocket fired signifies in the final sense, a theft from those who hunger and are not fed, those who are cold and are not clothed. This world in arms is not spending money alone. It is spending the sweat of its laborers, the genius of its scientists, the hopes of its children. This is not a way of life at all in any true sense. Under the clouds of war, it is humanity hanging on a cross of iron." -- Dwight D. Eisenhower

item.title: Vicki add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Folks are usually about as happy as they make their minds up to be." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Vicki add a quote by W. P. Kinsella
item.description: "Success is getting what you want, happiness is wanting what you get" -- W. P. Kinsella

item.title: Vicki add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Never trust anyone who has not brought a book with them." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Vicki add a quote by Henry Ward Beecherr
item.description: "Where is human nature so weak as in the bookstore?" -- Henry Ward Beecherr

item.title: Vicki add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "Do you like him much?' I told you I liked him a little. Where is the use of caring for him so very much: he is full of faults.' Is he?' All boys are." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Vicki add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "You have attributed conditions to villainy that simply result from stupidity." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Vicki add a quote by Napoleon Bonaparte
item.description: "Religion is excellent stuff for keeping common people quiet. Religion is what keeps the poor from murdering the rich." -- Napoleon Bonaparte

item.title: Vicki add a quote by Patrick Hemingway
item.description: "Literature is what intelligent people have instead of dope." -- Patrick Hemingway

item.title: Vicki add a quote by Socrates
item.description: "Our youth now love luxury. They have bad manners, contempt for authority; they show disrespect for their elders and love chatter in place of exercise; they no longer rise when elders enter the room; they contradict their parents, chatter before company; gobble up their food and tyrannize their teachers." -- Socrates

item.title: Vicki add a quote by Socrates
item.description: "He who is not contented with what he has, would not be contented with what he would like to have." -- Socrates
